meanings.definition: Ready to conform to the authority or will of others.
meanings.sent1: The submiss student always followed the teacher's instructions without question.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her submiss nature, always agreeing with whatever others suggested.
meanings.sent3: The submiss puppy obediently sat when told, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: Her submiss attitude towards her boss made her an easy target for extra work.
meanings.sent5: The submiss kitten allowed the children to dress it up in silly costumes without protest.

meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to be controlled or dominated by someone else.
meanings.sent1: He had a submiss demeanor, never challenging authority figures.
meanings.sent2: The submiss employee never questioned his boss's decisions.
meanings.sent3: The submiss robot followed every command, even the silly ones.
meanings.sent4: Her submiss behavior in the relationship led to her partner taking advantage of her.
meanings.sent5: The submiss child always let their older sibling choose the games they played together.

meanings.definition: Yielding or surrendering oneself to the will or authority of another.
meanings.sent1: The submiss monk devoted his life to serving his monastery.
meanings.sent2: She showed a submiss attitude towards her strict parents.
meanings.sent3: The submiss tree swayed gently in the wind, as if bowing to nature's will.
meanings.sent4: His submiss behavior in the negotiation resulted in him getting the short end of the stick.
meanings.sent5: The submiss clouds drifted across the sky, following the wind's direction without resistance.
